com.camerontec.util.collection

Class CollectionProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.CollectionProperties

  • public final class CollectionProperties
extends Object
    Class defining properties which may be supplied to the ICollectionRegistry when requesting collections.

    There is only one mandatory collection property:

    • DIRECTORY_NAME

    All others may be considered optional and are assumed to have sensible defaults.

    See individual property descriptions below for more information.

    Note also that this is not the complete set of available properties for any given concrete collection. Fine grained configuration is also available on a per collection type basis via:

    • HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStore
    • IndexedJournalingPersistentStore
    • MappedJournalingPersistentStore
    See Also:
    ICollectionRegistry

    • Field Detail

      • DIRECTORY_NAME

        public static final String DIRECTORY_NAME
        Property name defining a collection backing store directory name.

        All files associated with a collection are stored in the specified directory.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NAME

        public static final String NAME
        Property name defining the name under which a collection is registered in the collection registry. If this property is not specified, the value of property DIRECTORY_NAME is used instead.

        It is recommended to specify an explicit collection name though this property when then collection's directory name is long (for example if it is an absolute path), because collection names are exchanged between cluster nodes for the purpose of data replication and synchronization.

        Names specified using this property have to be unique across all collections bound to the collections registry.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SYNCH_AFTER_WRITE

        public static final String SYNCH_AFTER_WRITE
        Property name defining whether or not to synch with the file after every write.

        When this property is set to true it has the following implications:

        • Non HA: Writes to the collection's underlying persistence store are synchronized with the file system after each successful write. This may incur a significant performance overhead
        • HA: Writes to the collection's underlying persistence store are synchronized with the file system after a failed replication attempt.
        See Also:
        getSyncAfterWrite(Properties), Constant Field Values

      • IS_HIGH_CAPACITY_LIST

        public static final String IS_HIGH_CAPACITY_LIST
        Property name specifying whether or not a list requires high capacity.

        By default (i.e. unless this property is set), Lists behaves according to the general java.util.List contract and additionally provide persistence and are HA aware. Other characteristics are:

        • Read and write performance are both excellent
        • There are about 12 bytes of overhead associated with each element
        • Initialization time can be affected when the list grows large since, in order to maintain excellent write performance there is no on disk indices, which means they must be deduced on initialization.

        When very large lists are expected and low start times must be preserved, it is recommended to use this property to specify a high capacity list instead. The high capacity list has the following characteristics:

        • Slightly worse read and write performance than the default list
        • Fixed, configurable in memory overhead (default is 0.5 MB)
        • Initialization time is far less sensitive to the number of elements in the list
        • Parts of standard java.util.List contract are not honored.

        In particular, high capacity lists do not allow:

        • Removal of any but the last element
        • Setting of any element at an index other than the highest currently in the list.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • IS_CACHING_ENABLED

        public static final String IS_CACHING_ENABLED
        Property name which specifies whether objects caching is enabled for collections which support it.

        With caching enabled the underlying implementation maintains an on-heap, in memory objects cache for the purpose of improving read performance. Even though the read performance of the underlying persistent store is likely to be very good, there is still a cost associated with deserializing data. This cost may be avoided altogether in many cases via an adequate caching policy.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_CACHE_ELEMENTS

        public static final String MAX_CACHE_ELEMENTS
        Property name which specifies the maximum number of entries in the memory cache.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_CACHE_ELEMENTS

        public static final int DEFAULT_MAX_CACHE_ELEMENTS
        Default maximum number of cached elements.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_FILE_SIZE

        @Deprecated
public static final String MAX_FILE_SIZE
        Deprecated. Scheduled for removal - this property no longer has any meaning.
        Property name defining the maximum size of a collection backing file in bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_MAX_FILE_SIZE

        @Deprecated
public static final long DEFAULT_MAX_FILE_SIZE
        Deprecated. Scheduled for removal - this value no longer has any meaning.
        Default maximum file size in bytes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • REPLICATED

        public static final String REPLICATED
        Property name defining whether or not to replicate the collection's contents across cluster nodes. This property is only used in an HA context. When omitted, its value defaults to true, which means that collections get replicated by default.
        See Also:
        getReplicated(Properties), Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getDirectoryName

        public static String getDirectoryName(Properties properties)
                               throws CollectionRegistryException
        Extract the backing store directory name from the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties.
        Returns:
        The directory name if DIRECTORY_NAME is specified and not empty.
        Throws:
        CollectionRegistryException - When no directory name is specified.

      • getName

        public static String getName(Properties properties)
                      throws CollectionRegistryException
        Extract a collection's name from the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties.
        Returns:
        The value of property NAME if specified and not empty, or the value of property DIRECTORY_NAME otherwise.
        Throws:
        CollectionRegistryException - if both properties NAME and DIRECTORY_NAME are missing

      • getSyncAfterWrite

        public static boolean getSyncAfterWrite(Properties properties)
        Extract the synchronize after write flag from the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties.
        Returns:
        True if the SYNCH_AFTER_WRITE property is specified and set to true, false otherwise.

      • getIsHighCapacity

        public static boolean getIsHighCapacity(Properties properties)
        Extract the high capacity flag from the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties.
        Returns:
        True if the IS_HIGH_CAPACITY_LIST property is specified and set to true, false otherwise.

      • getIsCachingEnabled

        public static boolean getIsCachingEnabled(Properties properties)
        Extract the caching enabled flag from the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties.
        Returns:
        True unless the IS_CACHING_ENABLED property is specified and set to false.

      • getMaxCacheElements

        public static int getMaxCacheElements(Properties properties)
        Return the maximum number of cache elements implied in the specified properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - The properties.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of cache elements specified by the MAX_CACHE_ELEMENTS, or DEFAULT_MAX_CACHE_ELEMENTS if not specified or set less than 1.
